column5: News showed that a ramp at the top end of Simcoe in Orillia was open. There were talking about the perch fest.
Our view from the water surface this morning on Simcoe.  No launch required .
Looked a lot choppier when those kids were rescued.
The wind kicked up fast at around 9 Rob. When we got to shore,there were white caps forming. And we were in a sheltered bay.
On Paudash today the ice was 20-30 feet from shore

Went for a boat ride on scugog tonight . Shakedown went without aa hitch, so we spent a couple hours slayin crappies. Kept a dozen for dinner.....plan to hit another lake on the weekend for some bigger slabs.  S. We nailed them yesterday.......can't beat a good old fashion crappie fish fry with the Ugly Stick.

5 days ago Clear Lake in the Kawarthas was still covered in ice, 2 days ago the north half was open and the bottom half was still ice covered and this morning it's 100 % open water.  Sure is nice to finally see the sun sparkling on the waves.

5 days ago Clear Lake in the Kawarthas was still covered in ice, 2 days ago the north half was open and the bottom half was still ice covered and this morning it's 100 % open water.  Sure is nice to finally see the sun sparkling on the waves. good to know! Can't wait to get up there
Anyone know what the ice is like in the Pointe Au Baril area?

Sure is nice to finally see the sun sparkling on the waves.  Lew  Day two in the books out on the toon. Two beautiful sunrises.  Now to get out on the warmer waters so the feet are not freezing,then I,ll be happy, happier.

Still haven't got my marine railway fixed after last falls desaster but it's almost done. I am hoping to get it back in the water this week then it's "rebuild the dock time"!  Good thing I can catch walleye right off my shore line or I might be a little late getting out this year.
Tiffin launch Monday afternoon:      Storms in the forecast.
Wow   all these replies and the BOQ not mentioned once.   Seeing as I live 2.5 hrs away, any updates on Big Bay ?  appreciated.

Wow   all these replies and the BOQ not mentioned once.   Seeing as I live 2.5 hrs away, any updates on Big Bay ?  appreciated.  Can't help you first hand but the satellite image from yesterday is showing Big Bay ice covered for the most part.  The rest of the BOQ looks pretty much open but can't say for sure.  http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/modis.php?region=o&page=1&template=sub&image=a1.15102.1732.LakeOntario.143.250m.jpg
Tiffin launch Monday afternoon:      Storms in the forecast.  Just might see myself out there come Sunday.

This rain and wind tonight and the high temperatures the last two days have really done a number on Sturgeon lake but there is still plenty of ice in Goose Bay area. There is a lot of ice on the West shore and if the wind does decide to push it this way before it really softens up, it could make a mess. I'm not even going to TRY to do anything with my docks until for another two weeks yet. I have never seen it break up like this in 14 years!
I hear the ice is moving big time on simcoe right now pushing up on the south east shores
Yep, this wind is perfect for clearing out ice!  S.
Probably a few decks, boat houses and garages as well !
It certainly is!
Little Lake in Barrie is open in the middle but still ice around the shore. Won't last much longer though.

Nice I was looking good at little lake from the highway this morning and it looked open.  I'm thinking about going for a kayak later this week.  Do you think I will be able to get in and out from shore with no problems?

was in Pointe Au baril over the weekend, things still very locked up around there with 2 feet of solid ice, some cracks forming though, this warm weather should start to break things up a bit more. I was out on the ice though this weekend doing some work and it was solid. I have a feeling I will be dodging bergs on opener.  The small channels with current are open, but anywhere in the main area is very very solid still.
Tiffin today:        About a 100 metres open around most of the bottom of the bay. I'm getting a warm feeling.
yup I was there today, it was crying out to me but that heartless... B... utch  called work won . so I drove on by
Goose Bay is starting to shift, there is a pile about 6' high on the point over at the marina just South of our place.  My shore line is still solid.
Tiffin today:        About a 100 metres open around most of the bottom of the bay. I'm getting a warm feeling.   I,ll bet the smelts are staging. Got to get out and get me some this weekend.

The mild weather sure has done a number on southern Ontario!  Looks like Simcoe will be pretty much clear after a few more warm days and some wind!   Scugog and Rice look clear.  Kawarthas are well on their way too.  Now...what's scaring me are the threads about water levels!!!

I did a quick drive by Little Lake Barrie today, and I didn't see a spec of ice!  I'll be getting out for a rip in the Kayak at some point this week! I just don't know if it's worth bringing my Crappie gear.  I've actually never fished for them in the spring.
If you let me know when you are going I'll join you. I've been itching to get out.
Tiffin launch this afternoon.  Punky ice is back close to shore, lots of small openings out farther in the bay.
The light east blew it in. All will be gone by the weekend.

Went for a boat ride on scugog tonight . Shakedown went without aa hitch, so we spent a couple hours slayin crappies. Kept a dozen for dinner.....plan to hit another lake on the weekend for some bigger slabs.  S.
Tiffin launch Friday after lunch:   Ice against the shore towards Minett's point and out in the bay       Btw the ice was pushed up against the shore this morning.
Thanks Rob,won't be long now.Came by this afternoon,same picture .
People out on SUPs already!!

Lake O likely Shane, launches there are open, Chemong still locked, open on both sides of the causeway, on the Northside up to about the Dutch Marina, and on the southside  about 1/3rd of the way to the lighthouse on the east side, open along the perimeter of the causeway, warm temps and big winds can change things quickly, K Lake water levels are way down
I was down around lake Ontario about two weeks ago and it looked wide open south of Mississauga. Water level was way down though.
Scugog is mostly open now
Went across the Gardiner 3 days ago,lake O looked wide open in the TO area or waterfront anyway.
Thats good news! This wind will have it opened right up by morning I hope!  I can hear the crappies calling me alreadyy!  S.
a small lake near me is 100% open, I'll try and get pictures up

When I came across the causeway at Port Perry about 6:30 last night Scugog was open around the causeway but it looked like there was still a lot of ice out on the main body of the lake. Water level looked really low!
Great shot of southern Ontario.  Looks like Scugog is pretty much ice free.  Rice is breaking up quickly and parts of Sturgeon as well.

Great shot of southern Ontario. Looks like Scugog is pretty much ice free. Rice is breaking up quickly and parts of Sturgeon as well.  http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/modis.php?region=o&page=1&template=sub&image=a1.15101.1825.LakeOntario.143.250m.jpg You just killed me posting that. I was heading for Cooch today for one last shot on the ice but my American partner had to back out so I said no way on my own. Still looks pretty white. Probably would have been fine out of Airport road one last time. Tears in my eyes as I put my vex and ice rods away
not much left on G Bay either  http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/modis.php?region=h&page=1&template=sub&image=a1.15101.1825.LakeHuron.143.250m.jpg
Still about 30" on Kipawa as of today.  Highs forecasted in double digits for the rest of the month, so I hope to be out for specks and greys shortly after the Apr. 24 opener.  Will be very tight.
It's a confusing time of year...
Suits me fine. Boat is in the driveway itching to go! Might go tear up the bog after work tomorrow! Saaaweeeet!  S.
We still have a bit of ice. It was pretty warm today and there is water on the ice now.
Getting reports from a couple inland lakes in the Parry Sound area and they are telling me 17" - 20" of ice still .

http://www.portclintonnewsherald.com/story/news/local/lake-erie/2015/04/02/fishing-report-walleye-run-picking/70823222/   http://www.google.com/imgres?imgurl=http://coolwaterfish.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/twrcrowds.jpg&imgrefurl=http://coolwaterfish.com/the-walleye-run/&h=240&w=400&tbnid=ixe-N6idz9BTbM:&zoom=1&docid=0SehVVQxykfvBM&ei=cfopVfKBN8bboATK8YG4Ag&tbm=isch&ved=0CB8QMygCMAI

Sturgeon lake is starting to break along the shorelines & wind is starting to move the ice pack around a bit !!! Emily creek is blown open as well as lower pigeon lake I even seen an osprey yesterday by next weekend she will be all gone !!!! With the mild temps Comming
Is this off of Sturgeon Point? Where is the second picture from on the lake.

​The approach at the entrance to the ice road on my lake is getting a tad damp.      The portage is starting to get gummy too.    Managed a couple of final trips to the cabin to drop off a bunch of rigid insulation and other items needed when the ice goes out.      Ice on the lake is still 4 to 5 feet thick.
Cool pictures Dave.

Scugog looks wide open driving by. Saw a boat flying across from Port.  Upper Buckhorn open as far as the eye can see from Gannon Narrows.  South Pigeon partly open. North Pigeon still locked up but ice is soft  Won't be long now with the warm forecast
At a G Bay trib yesterday. Just a tiny bit of ice in the background.
Rice yesterday, Bo-Didley end... Starting to pull off shores but all islands down threw are still locked up.
An old timer I was talking to said the big lakes in Haliburton should be mostly open water by next weekend.

Modis satellite view from yesterday.  You can see the west side of Lake Simcoe is clearing as well as large spots on Scugog.    You can see the latest satellite shots here....some days are cloudy and you don't see much but the clear days have awesome shots.  http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/modis.php?region=o&page=1

i think you will find that simoce ice is turning that colour and is porous and full of water, but intact, or I was walking on water yesterday,.......................... hmmm   might explain a few things  .........lol

i think you will find that simoce ice is turning that colour and is porous and full of water, but intact, or I was walking on water yesterday,.......................... hmmm   might explain a few things  .........lol   LOL
I usually drive by the bottom end of Kempenfelt 6-8 times a week. I'll post updates as things progress. Nothing really open there yet, just clear ice.

Here are a couple updates for everyone as of April 1st Algonquin Park North   27" - 30 " Algonquin Park South  25" - 27" Burks Falls Area          25" - 28" Parry Sound (inland)   20" -  24"  This info. is from various sources of mine and not first hand accounts . Still lots of winter left in the north !
Sturgeon lake & kawarthas & Haliburton still solid (    Gonna be a while yet
5 feet of ice everywhere up here.
5 feet of ice everywhere up here.  Guess you'll be checking back in late June.
Canal on west side of Balsam is just opened- barely into the lake itself yet- water level is way, way down.
Wednesday.. before the 19 degree Thursday..

Wednesday.. before the 19 degree Thursday..   Those docks look to be secure there Wayne. Have you seen the one that was out and about?  The bay here is very grey. You can see the 3 transitions of freeze up very clearly from the shore.  I,ll bet I,ll be perching from the toon by the end of the month.  Would like to be crappie fishing by then on another lake though.
That dock will be locked in for at least 2 more weeks Brian! It's between the Greens and Snake.
Was out fishin on thursday 3+ ft of Ice on sturgeon oncenu get 40 ft from shore
Temps are wandering from 50 to 65 here for the next 7 days, I hope he heat wave is making it's way north!
Barrie Marina this morning. Will be a bit yet.
Gull Lake Haliburton, 15" of good ice, 5" of crap ice on top, some receding around the shores with lots of sun exposure.
Kempenfelt Bay at the Tiffin launch this afternoon:
This guy was wayyyyyy out. Not sure what he was catching.
What is it B? Hard to tell from the pic..... A person?
did you click on it to make it  bigger ? yes it's a person fishing
I just called to get my boat out of storage this weekend and was told it is a snowing in Bancroft

What is it B? Hard to tell from the pic..... A person?   Trying to get away from photo bucket G  It seems if you click on the pic,it enlarges. And yes, an angler out in the 70-80 fow . Maybe the blaze orange tuque is so they can see him bobbing.
Hope he made it back
This wind and warm weather should help open up some water. I'm hoping I can launch the boat somewhere next weekend.  S.
April 7th 2015
